text: Yes I am aware of the steps, I am just worried how this will affect our ranking, SEO etc since the pages with other URLs already exist

Indeed, there can't be multiple pages under the same URL exist parallel. You need a language parameter in the URL. Something like /de/... /en/..., or the URL itself is translated. Last options are subdomains, but subdomains are separate ranking containers for search engines, so better avoid that, until you want each language to rank differently. I suggest folders like /en/... and, not sure, but HubSpot should do the redirect automaticity with a wildcard entry: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/set-up-a-flexible-pattern-url-redirect>, is a 301 Permanent Redirect, search engine and SEO tools maybe use a moment, but understand that; raking will be inherited. Different thing are campaigns, Google Ads or other advertisement, they often need a direct page and will reject redirect URLs, so they have to be changed manually, otherwise failures or fallbacks take place, that should be highly avoided.
